title: Alcohol consumption per country
text:
Why for?
This is a Quarto presentation that determines your nationality based on your annual alcohol consumption!



https://www.ameli.fr/


Let‚Äôs go‚Ä¶

title: How we did it and example
text:
Process
Interested by the project ?
RCompendium was used to realise this project.
It is available on Github.

We asked people how many glasses they drank last week by categories.


Beer (25 cl) üç∫
Wine (10 cl) üç∑
Apetizer (7 cl) üçπ
Liquor (2.5 cl) ü•õ


From those data we estimated the year consumption usign the function consumption_year():


consumption_year <- function(data) {
    alcool_wine <- data$wine * 0.12 * 0.1 # wine conversion
    alcool_beer <- data$beers * 0.05 * 0.25 # beer conversion
    alcool_liquor <- data$liquor * 0.4 * 0.025 # liquor conversion
    alcool_apetizer <- data$apetizer * 0.18 * 0.07 # apetizer conversion
    cons_week <- alcool_wine + alcool_beer + alcool_liquor + alcool_apetizer # estimated consommation per week
    cons_year <- cons_week * 52 # estimated consommation per year
    data |> dplyr::mutate(cons_year)
}


When giving your weekly consommation, we will estimate which country best suit you ! It will be your alcoholic country (see Figure¬†1.1) !







Figure¬†1.1: Alcohol consumption per countries

crumbs: How we did it and example

title: Reveal your country !!!
text:
Figure¬†1: Alcohol is dangerous to your health



Please enter your alcohol consumption of last week in the following table :



Table¬†1: Number of glasses per category during the last week





Beer
Wine
Apetizer
Liquor
Country




15
10
5
1
France






From the result in Table¬†1 we can obtain your country using the function pays_similaire():

pays_similaire <- function(small_data, world_data) {
  dataMerged <- merge(small_data, world_data)

  data_pays_simi <- dataMerged |>
    dplyr::mutate(diff.per = abs(cons_year - conso)) |>
    dplyr::group_by(id) |>
    dplyr::mutate(minDiff = min(diff.per)) |>
    dplyr::filter(diff.per == minDiff) |>
    dplyr::select(
      id,
      age,
      pseudonyme,
      Entity,
      country.residence,
      Code,
      conso,
      cons_year
    )
  return(data_pays_simi)
}

Let‚Äôs run the code‚Ä¶.
Go next page to see your result !
